result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam L Malmquist was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Adam L Malmquist is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Adam L Malmquist was found guilty of Carry Handgun-Alcohol Sold/Consumed, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.237(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated

supervisions.notes: Pay a fine of $500.00 including all mandtory costs, fees and surcharges, $200.00 to be paid FORTHWITH and balance by 12-28-15 or serve 25 consecutive days in HOC.

Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Court STAYED the commencement until 12-28-15. If defendant answer subpoena and testifies court would allow the sentence to be served on ES

Defendant Adam L Malmquist in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.as to count three: 

  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 10 days in the House of Correction,  with credit for 0 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Court stayed the commencment until 12-28-15. If defendant answer subpeona and testifies court would allow the sentence to be served on ES.  

 Fine of $500.00 including  all mandatory costs , fees and surcharges to be paid $200.00 forthwith and balance by 12-28-15 or serve 25 consecutive days in the House of Correction. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Adam L Malmquist in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNT THREE: 
 Defendant waived rights and pled no contest .  No Contest Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a no contest  plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

ON MOTION OF THE STATE, COURT ORDERED COUNTS ONE AND TWO:  DISMISSED 

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Adam L Malmquist in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.vb
